skill.name: cass
skill.description: Coding Agent Session Search - unified CLI/TUI to index and search local coding agent history from Claude Code, Codex, Gemini, Cursor, Aider, ChatGPT, Pi-Agent, Factory, and more. Purpose-built for AI agent consumption with robot mode.
skill.summary: Coding Agent Session Search - unified CLI/TUI to index and search local coding agent history from Cl...
skill.author: Dicklesworthstone

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill describing a CLI tool for indexing and searching local AI agent session data. Accesses agent-specific directories for legitimate search functionality. No malicious patterns detected.

low_findings.title: Filesystem access to agent directories
low_findings.description: The tool accesses agent session directories including ~/.claude/projects, ~/.codex/sessions, ~/Library/Application Support/Cursor, and ~/Library/Application Support/com.openai.chat. This is legitimate for a search tool but represents broad filesystem access. Quote from SKILL.md lines 78-83: 'Claude Code sessions in ~/.claude/projects, Codex sessions in ~/.codex/sessions, Cursor state in SQLite databases, Aider history in markdown files'.

low_findings.title: SSH/rsync for remote synchronization
low_findings.description: Remote sources feature uses SSH and rsync to sync sessions from other machines. Configuration stored in ~/.config/cass/sources.toml. Lines 264-269: 'Discovers SSH hosts from ~/.ssh/config, Probes each for agent data and cass installation, Indexes sessions on remotes'.

content.value_statement: Finding past solutions across multiple AI coding agents is difficult when sessions are scattered. CASS unifies search across 11 agents including Claude Code, Codex, Cursor, and ChatGPT into a single index with robot mode for AI consumption.
actual_capabilities: Index and search 11 AI coding agent session histories
JSON output with --robot flag for AI agent consumption
Remote source sync via SSH for multi-machine setups
Token budget management for LLM context limits
limitations: Requires local installation of the CASS CLI tool
Accesses pre-existing agent session files only
Does not modify or create new agent sessions
ChatGPT v2/v3 encryption requires keychain access

use_cases.title: Cross-agent solutions
use_cases.description: Search across all your past agent sessions to find solutions you discovered before

use_cases.title: Agent handoffs
use_cases.description: Search past sessions to understand context before taking over a task from another agent

use_cases.title: Session exploration
use_cases.description: Review your daily work across all coding agents with timeline and aggregation views

best_practices: Always use --robot or --json flags for machine-readable output
Run cass health before searching to verify index status
Use --fields minimal for token budget-constrained queries
anti_patterns: Running bare cass without flags (blocks terminal with interactive TUI)
Skipping --limit on broad queries (exceeds context limits)
Assuming all agents are indexed without running cass stats --json

faq.question: Which agents are supported?
faq.answer: CASS supports 11 agents: Claude Code, Codex, Gemini CLI, Cline, OpenCode, Amp, Cursor, ChatGPT, Aider, Pi-Agent, and Factory (Droid).

faq.question: What are the search limits?
faq.answer: Prefix searches complete in 2-8ms cached, 40-60ms cold. Full reindex takes 5-30s. Health checks complete in under 50ms.

faq.question: How do I integrate with AI agents?
faq.answer: Use --robot flag for JSON output. Run cass capabilities --json for feature discovery and cass introspect --json for full API schema.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: CASS only reads existing session files in agent directories. No data is sent to external services. Remote sync uses SSH with your credentials.

faq.question: Why are results empty?
faq.answer: Run cass health to check index status. If unhealthy, run cass index --full. Use cass stats --json to verify connectors detected your agent data.

faq.question: How does CASS compare to native search?
faq.answer: CASS provides unified cross-agent search with BM25 ranking, time filters, and AI-optimized output. Native tools only search single agents.
